On 2/3/06, Marvin Toll <MarvinToll@...> wrote:
>
>
> This is very =
interesting - and the scope could go beyond simply
> accessor methods.  For=
 instance, the application chronicled
> in "TestUtil: By Example" contains =
about 5,000 methods (~3,000 are
> accessors).  It might be useful to have a=
 list of which of those
> 5,000 signatures, that include a parameter of typ=
e Object, do not
> throw an exception for a null argument.


It's sometimes=
 okay for methods to receive null arguments.  You would need a
way to diffe=
rentiate methods that need a non-null parameter (@NonNull) but
even so, the=
 method is probably going to throw an NPE, so where is the added
value?

Do=
n't get me wrong, the idea is interesting, I'm just trying to come up with
=
the example of a bug that would be faster to find using this method...
